document.masterDocTitle: Report on crane flies of the genus Tipula (Diptera: Tipulidae: Tipulinae) from Anhui Province, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Report on crane flies of the genus Tipula (Diptera: Tipulidae: Tipulinae) from Anhui Province, China

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of the subgenus
Emodotipula

subSubSection.paragraph: This key is compiled based on the published literature in an effort to facilitate the separation of the new species from other known species.

paragraph.keyLead: – Scutum with a stripe or variegated by brown or grey in central area. .......................... 4

3 Tergite nine with sublateral bilobed projection, lateral and median lobes (see ALEXAN- DER 1966: 247, Pl. 3, Fig. 29 ). ...............................
T .
( E .) fabriciana
Alexander, 1966

4 Tergite nine with hind margin produced into 2 rounded lobes, with a pair of smaller rounded lobes near them (see ALEXANDER 1970: 331 , Fig. 30 ). ....................................... .......................................................................
T .
( E .) goetghebuerana
Alexander, 1970
– Tergite nine with hind margin not produced into 2 rounded lobes as above.................5

5 Caudal margin of tergite nine with 2 connected median finger-shaped processes (see YOUNG 2014: 236 , Fig. 4B ). ........................................
T . ( E .) thailandica
Young, 2014
– Caudal margin of tergite nine without such process......................................................6

6 Caudal margin of tergite nine with a rounded median process (see ALEXANDER 1935b: 134 , Pl. 2, Fig. 25 ). ............................................
T .
( E .) multibarbata
Alexander, 1935
– Caudal margin of tergite nine without such median process as above..........................7

7 Outer gonostylus rounded apically (see ALEXANDER 1936: 399 , Pl. 3, Fig. 38). .............. ...............................................................
T .
( E .) submarmoratipennis
Alexander, 1936

– Caudal margin of tergite nine without such processes (see ALEXANDER 1920: 16 ; ALEXAN- DER 1953: Pl. 1, Fig. 8 ). ........................................
T .
( E .) naviculifer
Alexander, 1920
10 Tergite nine with a pair of finger-shaped processes in middle. .................................. 11

12 .. Caudal margin of tergite nine with central area sunken, apex bilobed (see ALEXANDER 1961: 440 , Pl. 3, Fig. 28 ). .......................................
T .
( E .) stylostena
Alexander, 1961

14 Caudal margin of tergite nine with a pair of blackened cushions (see ALEXANDER 1968: 358 , Pl. 2, Fig. 17 ). ...........................................
T .
( E .) hemmingseni
Alexander, 1968

– Caudal margin of tergite nine without such cushions (see YOUNG 2014: 234 , Fig. 2B ). .....................................................................................
T . ( E .) lishanensis
Young, 2014
16 Tergite nine separated by a U-shaped notch in caudal margin. .................................. 17
18 Tergite nine with a median process in caudal margin. ................................................ 19

– Tergite nine without a median process in caudal margin (see ALEXANDER 1964: 92 , Pl. 3, Fig. 32 ). ................................................................
T .
( E .) vaillantiana
Alexander, 1964

19 Caudal margin of tergite nine with a pair of horn-shaped processes (see ALEXANDER 1935a: 540 , Pl. 3, Fig. 36). ...................................
T . ( E .) multisetosa
Alexander, 1935
– Caudal margin of tergite nine without such horn-shaped processes. .......................... 20

20 Inner gonostylus with posterior angle distinctly produced (see DUFOUR 1991: 82 , Fig. 1D ); hypovalva with a pair of lateral processes (see DUFOUR 1991: 83 , Fig. 2B ). .......... ......................................................................................
T .
( E .) saginata
Bergroth, 1891

– Inner gonostylus with posterior angle slightly produced (see DUFOUR 1991: 85 , Fig. 4D ); hypovalva without lateral processes (see DUFOUR 1991: 83 , Fig. 2D ). ........................... .................................................................................
T .
( E .) obscuriventris
Strobl, 1900
